rename.from: Allow to configure Migrate lock timeout

issue.title: Remove migration lock timeout

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Log migration lock acquisition
Move seeding to options

Fixes #34196
Fixes #17578

body:
A thought I had since our discussion on this: do we support proper cancellation when applying migrations? If so, it could still make sense to have a timeout on the migrations apply, implemented via the cancellation token. Since the timeout and lock would be fully controlled by the .NET client, we don't have the problem we discussed where the lock expires autonomously server-side while we're still applying migrations. This would at least allow termination in the case of a network partition, and if users want it, maybe also terminate long migration batches, either manually via the token or timeout-based (whether we want it on by default is another question).

The logic here is basically that it's a good idea to allow cancellation (and timeout) for any potentially long-running async operation...

(but I think this can be a future feature)

We have a cancellation token on MigrateAsync. Are you suggesting that we add it to Migrate as well? In case of a network partition it would still not stop execution before some other exception is thrown

@AndriySvyryd good point. I guess this is more about making sure we have a command-line mechanism for setting client-side timeout when applying migrations (e.g. via bundle). Having that set CommandTimeout (as opposed to anything via the cancellation token) is probably sufficient - and this would take care of sync I/O scenarios as well.
The command-line tools use the same infrastructure, so the `CommandTimeout` DbContext option would be used.
